result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA Surcharge=payment to be worked out with agent. Payment of any fees associated with Marinette County Drug Court.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, illegal in WI today including THC, without a valid Rx. No contact with known drug users or sellers, unless in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval. No contact with the victims, without prior agent approval.

May take medications prescribed by a physician with prior agent approval. Must take any medication prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. Full compliance with the Marinette County Drug Court Program. Full compliance with the Deferred Judgment Agreement. Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Payment of restitution if claim is made. DNA Sample Due: 7-13-2022.

10:55 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Demorest Lamont Anthony Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Demorest Lamont Anthony Jr. 
Court calls cases 22CF96 and 22CF114. 
DA spks on structure of offer. 
Court responds.
Court discusses Drug Court requirements with deft. 
Deft understands. 
Atty provides plea form.
11:12 AM off record.
11:16 AM on record.
Court advises parties on decision to not withhold sentences for Drug Court participants- if accepts arrangement case will be imposed and stayed.
Deft agrees to proceed.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 in 22CF96.
Deft enters No Contest Plea.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 7 in 22CF114. 
Deft enters Guilty Plea. 
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 in 22CF114.
Deft enters No Contest Plea. 
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty on Count 1 in 22CF96, Count 7 in 22CF114 and court withholds findings of guilt, pursuant to the Deferred Judgment Agreement on Count 1 in 22CF114. 
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2-5 in 22CF96 and Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, and 10 in 22CF114. 
DA heard on recommendation and sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court impose and stayed on 22CF96: 18 months IC, 3 Years ES and places deft on probation for 3 years. 
Conditions of probation on 22CF96:
Payment of any fees associated with Marinette County Drug Court. 
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge- Payment to be worked out with agent. 
1 year jail- impose and stayed to be used by Marinette County Drug Court for sanctions. 
May take medications prescribed by a physician with prior agent approval. 
Must take any medication prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, illegal in WI today including THC, without a valid Rx. 
No contact with known drug users or sellers, unless in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval. 
No contact with the victims, without prior agent approval. 
Full compliance with the Marinette County Drug Court program.
Full compliance with the Deferred Judgment Agreement. 
Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
Payment of restitution if claim is made. 
DNA Sample Due: 7-13-2022.
Court impose and stayed on 22CF114: 6 Months IC, consecutive to 22CF96. and places deft on probation for 1 year. 
Conditions of probation on 22CF114:
Payment of any fees associated with Marinette County Drug Court. 
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge- Payment to be worked out with agent. 
May take medications prescribed by a physician with prior agent approval. 
Must take any medication prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, illegal in WI today including THC, without a valid Rx. 
No contact with known drug users or sellers, unless in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval. 
No contact with the victims, without prior agent approval. 
Full compliance with the Marinette County Drug Court program.
Full compliance with the Deferred Judgment Agreement. 
Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
Payment of restitution if claim is made. 
DNA Sample Due: 7-13-2022. 
Not eligible for CIP or SAP. 
Victim rights compliance. 
Appeal rights.
